CUSTOM-FIELDS.regex_remove_keyword_explanation:
For this option to be taken into account, the keyword must be present in the regular expression and the regular expression must end with .*
Example: INVOICE\s*NUMBER\s*:\s*.*
CUSTOM-FIELDS.regex_remove_keyword_hint: If enabled, the keyword will be removed from the regex result to keep only the data
CUSTOM-FIELDS.regex_remove_special_char: Remove special characters from regex result

WORKFLOW.step_input_verifier: # The `main` function will be called when processing a document, do not change the name of this function # This script will be performed before the `processing` part, if the latter is activated # From the `input` step you have access to the following variables: # - ip --> (string) IP address of the user # - user_info --> (string) Current user information # - custom_id --> (string) Custom ID # - file --> (string) Full path of the file to process # - opencapture_path --> (string) Root of Open-Capture installation folder # - log --> (Log class) Instance of the Log class allowing to log (info or error) different data # - input_path --> (string) Document capture path # - customer_id --> (integer) Customer account identifier # - ia_model_id --> (integer) AI model id # From the `enter` step you have access to the following functions: # - send_to_workflow() --> Sending the document to another workflow # - arguments: ip, log, file, user_info, workflow_id, custom_id # The list of available Python libraries can be seen here: # https://github.com/edissyum/opencapture/blob/master/bin/install/pip-requirements.txt # This script is an example to read the QR codes in the document being processed # If the content of the QR Code has the keyword invoice, the workflow continues # Otherwise, the workflow stops and another one is automatically launched import pdf2image from pyzbar.pyzbar import decode from src.backend.scripting_functions import send_to_workflow def read_qrcode(args): args['log'].info('Search for QR code in document') pages = pdf2image.convert_from_path(args['file']) barcodes = [] cpt = 0 for page in pages: detected_barcode = decode(page) if detected_barcode: for barcode in detected_barcode: if barcode.type == 'QRCODE': barcodes.append({'text': barcode.data.decode('utf-8')}) cpt += 1 return barcodes def main(args): args['log'].info(f"Processing file {args['file']}") barcodes = read_qrcode(args) is_invoice = False for barcode in barcodes: if 'facture' in barcode['text'].lower(): is_invoice = True if is_invoice: args['log'].info('The document is indeed an invoice, processing continues...') else: args['log'].info('The document is not an invoice, starting the workflow ocr_only') res = send_to_workflow({ 'ip': args['ip'], 'log': args['log'], 'file': args['file'], 'user_info': args['user_info'], 'workflow_id': 'ocr_only', 'custom_id': args['custom_id'], }) return res
WORKFLOW.step_output_verifier:
# The `main` function will be called after the execution of the outgoing strings, do not change the name of this function
# This script will be done after the `output` part

# From the `output` step you have access to the following variables:
# - custom_id --> (string) Custom ID
# - document_id --> (integer) ID of the document in DB
# - file --> (string) Full path of the file on the docserver
# - opencapture_path --> (string) Root of Open-Capture installation folder
# - outputs --> (array) List of output string parameters associated with the workflow
# - document_info --> (array) Document information after processing from interface
# - log --> (Log class) Instance of the Log class allowing to log (info or error) different data

# From the `output` step you have access to the following functions:
# - update_document_data() --> Allows modification of document data
# - args: (array) Associative array containing the data to modify:
# - List of recoverable fields:
#               - Supplier :
# - name, address1, address2, postal_code, city, country, email, vat_number, iban, siret, siren
# - Billing:
# - invoice_number, document_date, document_due_date, quotation_number, delivery_number, vat_amount
# - no_rate_amount, vat_rate, total_ht, total_vat, total_ttc
# - Custom fields: identifier of the custom field

# - Example of the call (custom_id and document_id are required):
# - update_document_data({
# 'custom_id: args['custom_id'],
# 'document_id': args['document_id'],
# 'data': {
# 'invoice_number': args['datas']['invoice_number'] + '-EDISSYUM'
# }
# })

# The list of available Python libraries can be seen here:
# https://github.com/edissyum/opencapture/blob/master/bin/install/pip-requirements.txt

# This script is an example allowing to modify the invoice number of a document after execution of the outgoing chains
# It starts by modifying the information in the database then modifies the XML file if an outgoing string of this type is present

import xml.etree.ElementTree as Et
from src.backend.scripting_functions import update_document_data


def main(args):
    args['log'].info(f"[OUTPUT SCRIPT] Processing data from file {args['file']} after processing")

    if 'document_id' in args and args['document_id'] is not None:
        args['log'].info(f"[OUTPUT SCRIPT] Document ID: {args['document_id']}")

        if 'invoice_number' in args['datas']:
            args['log'].info('[OUTPUT SCRIPT] Add suffix to invoice number')
            update_document_data({
                'custom_id': args['custom_id'],
                'document_id': args['document_id'],
                'data': {
                    'invoice_number': args['datas']['invoice_number'] + '-EDISSYUM'
                }
            })

    if 'outputs' in args and args['outputs']:
        for output in args['outputs']:
            if output['output_type_id'] == 'export_xml':
                args['log'].info('[OUTPUT SCRIPT] Modifying XML file')
                xml_content = Et.parse(output['file_path'])
                root = xml_content.getroot()
                for data in root.findall('DATAS'):
                    data.find('invoice_number').text = data.find('invoice_number').text + '-EDISSYUM'
                xml_content.write(output['file_path'])
    return True
WORKFLOW.step_process_verifier:
# The `main` function will be called after processing a document, do not change the name of this function
# This script will be performed after the `processing` part

# From the `process` step you have access to the following variables:
# - custom_id --> (string) Custom ID
# - file --> (string) Full path of the file to process
# - opencapture_path --> (string) Root of Open-Capture installation folder
# - log --> (Log class) Instance of the Log class allowing to log (info or error) different data
# - process_info --> (array) Processing parameters of the current workflow chain
# - document_id --> (integer) ID of the document in DB
# - document_info --> (array) Document information found automatically

# From the `process` step you have access to the following functions:
# - update_document_data() --> Allows modification of document data
# - arguments: (array) Associative array containing the data to modify:
# - List of editable fields:
#               - Supplier :
# - name, address1, address2, postal_code, city, country, email, vat_number, iban, siret, siren
# - Billing:
# - invoice_number, document_date, document_due_date, quotation_number, delivery_number, vat_amount
# - no_rate_amount, vat_rate, total_ht, total_vat, total_ttc
# - Custom fields: identifier of the custom field

# - Example of the call (custom_id and document_id are required):
# - update_document_data({'custom_id: args['custom_id'], 'document_id': args['document_id'], 'datas': {'invoice_number': 123456789}})

# The list of available Python libraries can be seen here:
# https://github.com/edissyum/opencapture/blob/master/bin/install/pip-requirements.txt

# This script is an example for setting a default invoice number
# If no invoice number was found, in order to facilitate the search

from src.backend.scripting_functions import update_document_data


def main(args):
    args['log'].info(f"Processing data from file {args['file']}")
    if 'document_id' in args:
        args['log'].info(f"Document ID: {args['document_id']}")

        if 'invoice_number' not in args['datas']:
            args['log'].info('Invoice number modification')
            update_document_data({
                'custom_id': args['custom_id'],
                'document_id': args['document_id'],
                'data': {
                    'invoice_number': 'INVOICE_NOT_FOUND'
                }
            })
    return True
WORKFLOW.test_input_folder: Verify if input folder exists and is writable
